H0.text: What gas, symbol F, is the most reactive of all chemical elements. Fluorine

H1.text: What gas, symbol F, is the most reactive of all chemical elements. Floridum

H2.text: What gas, symbol F, is the most reactive of all chemical elements. Felinium

H3.text: What gas, symbol F, is the most reactive of all chemical elements. Ftor

A4.text: Fluorine is extremely reactive as it reacts with all other elements except for the light noble gases.

A5.text: The bond energy of difluorine is much lower than that of either Cl2 or Br2 and similar to the easily cleaved peroxide bond; this, along with high electronegativity, accounts for fluorine's easy dissociation, high reactivity, and strong bonds to non-fluorine atoms.
